website_summaries.verdict: A premium pepper grinder that is expertly crafted, portable, and easy to use.
pros: Stainless steel craftsmanship delivers a great blend of style and function
Rust-free and non-corrosive ceramic rotors are built to last
cons: Requires four AA batteries that are not included

customer_reviews.title: Fun to use
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this set of grinders about a month ago. Was impressed with the quality look and feel when I opened them. Exceeded my expectations. Very impressive to display on the counter. Once I installed the 8 batteries required for the set, it worked better than I expected. They work smooth, quiet and consistent. The button on top is easy to use and they are now the conversation piece in the kitchen. Purchased through amazon but received a personal hand written thank you from the owner. That happens very infrequent in this day and age. I feel confident that if I have any issues they would take care of it. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it should
customer_reviews.text: I like and use a lot of pepper. Most grinders and even the old fashioned shakers do not dispense a sufficient amount. On the shakers, I unscrew the cap and dispense the amount I want. With other electric grinders the amount of pepper is lacking. These grinders work wonderfully. The light is kinda nice but the fact that it grinds pepper is what makes me happy.
customer_reviews.author: John Lane, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: NOT-so-Great grinders!
customer_reviews.text: So far these work really well. I like the little light. ***UPDATE - we bought these the beginning of January and they already stopped working! The motor is still spinning but all of a sudden it stopped grinding the peppercorns.
customer_reviews.author: Nrconder

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work with Himalayan sea salt!
customer_reviews.text: Does not work with Himalayan sea salt! Mine worked about 3 seconds then stopped. I shook it a few times to loosen the jam but it never worked again. customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy and not very powerful for grinding pepper

One of the mills rolled off my counter and stopped working completely. I tried swapping out the new batteries. I tried swapping the pepper and salt chambers. Nothing worked. This is not a good product. I threw them away and bought better ones at Williams Sonoma. I would NOT recommend these.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Normally, I am not the person writing reviews. This time, however, I feel compelled to write a review. In January, I bought an electric salt-and-pepper set from LuxeCulina. However, the salt mill did not work correctly so I contacted LuxeCulina. After verifying this was a defective item, I was informed that a replacement set was on its way. Since three months, my wife is using the mills extensively and they work flawlessly. They are a nice addition to our kitchen. I feel that LuxeCulina's response to the problem was really exceptional and worth writing this review. They really stand behind their product.

New batteries = grinder works great for a couple weeks... then the batteries don't supply enough power to turn the grinders. Worst thing is - the batteries AREN'T bad, just not at full charge. So, it doesn't really "eat" batteries so much as the designed power input was sized terribly.

Also, I’ve replaced many grinders after a short time because they no longer grind peppercorns. Hopefully, these grinder blades are of better quality. Another feature I like is the cap at the bottom so that we don’t have salt and pepper flakes all over the table.
